parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "NAMD",
  "details": {
    "software": [
      "NAMD2",
      "charmrun"
    ],
    "resources": {
      "nodes": 4,
      "processors_per_node": 2,
      "walltime": "48:00:00",
      "scratch_directory": "$PBS_TMPDIR",
      "input_files": [
        "namdinclude.tcl",
        "clusters_new.par",
        "CHARMM_22prot_27lip.par",
        "dynamics.namd",
        "dyn_${TIME}_in.*",
        "$PSFFILE",
        "nodelist"
      ],
      "output_files": [
        "dyn_${TIME}.log",
        "*_out.*"
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

This script uses the NAMD molecular dynamics simulation package, running it with the Charm++ runtime system. It utilizes 8 processors (4 nodes x 2 processors per node) for a simulation duration of 48 hours. The script prepares input files from the user's home directory and copies them to the PBS temporary directory ($PBS_TMPDIR) for execution. After the simulation, output files are copied back to the user's home directory.
